name: Bellafonte Chateau de la Mer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed here for the weekend and loved it. We stayed here with 4 people and rented a two bedroom apartment. Everything you want and need is in the apartment and it looks great. The large balcony has direct sea view.
reviews.title: Just perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011
reviews.text: The apartments are out of town, which makes a rental car necessary.
reviews.title: The best hotel ever! Great location, great service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I came to bonaire searching for a good place oceanfront and I discovered a real Paridise! Excellent service, free wi-fi, amazing sunset, a perfect dock on which spending the day if you do not want to go to the beach. Close to Kralendijk, the main city, but far enough to have peace an nature at its best. i was in the #204, perfect to me.
reviews.title: Absolutely lovely

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed for a week in April. This was our first time staying here even though we have been coming to Bonaire for many years. We chose the Bellafonte after looking at the grounds on our previous trip last November and after reading the excellent reviews on TripAdvisor - we were not disappointed! The rooms were clean, the kitchen was beautiful, and Robbert and Ellen were as gracious and accommodating as they could be. We did not dive behind the hotel, mainly because of the boat traffic, but several other guests did and said it was a great spot. I don't know any dive sites on Bonaire that are not great. The dive locker on site was very convenient, as were the outdoor showers. The grounds were well maintained and housekeeping came every day. Just a very lovely spot - we would most definitely stay here again. Good food at Bistro de Paris and Sunset Cafe. Disappointed in food at La Luna and It Rains Fishes this trip.
reviews.title: Wonderful experience, we´ll return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a week in Suite 302, very comfortable! Kitchen was well equiped, we only missed having an oven since we cooked a lot , my teens are always hungry, especially after diving.
reviews.title: Wonderful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011
reviews.text: Building looks somewhat intimidating. However, the ocean view appartments are excellent. Direct access to the ocean for swimming, snorkelling and diving. Not very big and reasonably quiet. Near airport, so you hear aircraft approaching and departing, but who cares while on holiday? Excellent service by Robbert and his team.
reviews.title: Top place with top service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a week here and my stay could not have been better! Robert is the most gracious, helpful, and friendly person and he made sure I was comfortable, happy, and was always happy to answer any question.
reviews.title: A must do if you come to Bonaire! Robert is WONDERFUL! Gorgeous property :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The main purpose of my trip was to go shore diving, and having a house reef was so convenient and wonderful! Who needs a pool when the ocean is right there? Plus, there were showers and a jacuzzi tub to relax in after a long day of diving.
reviews.title: What a fantastic experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I have done quite a bit of traveling and am very picky about where I stay. I did a LOT of research about accomodations on Bonaire and I am so glad that I picked Bellafonte.
reviews.title: This is an awesome hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The balcony was a wonderful place to sit and enjoy the gorgeous daily views. The hotel does not have a restaurant but being that you are no more than a 10 minute drive to town and you have a full kitchen, that was definitely not an issue. I was in close proximity to the airport, Lac Bay, and many of the dive sites on the southern part of the island (which I found to have calmer waters), I could not have picked a better place.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: This was my 6th trip to Bonaire and my first stay at Bellafonte. Location and view wonderful, service was the best I've experienced, room was just what I wanted..on ground floor right on the water. Robbert, the manager, and all of his staff were helpful and responsive to anything. As a sole traveler I am very aware of personal service and attention, this was the best I've experienced. I highly recommend Bellafonte and will certainly return.
reviews.title: The absolute best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is our second trip to Bonaire, staying 2 weeks in February over Karnaval (many different spellings). During our first trip in 2007, we stayed at Harbour Village which we loved, but for the price Bellafonte is better, although different. Our 1 bedroom grand suite was overly spacious for the furniture supplied, but had a generous terrace (on which we spent most of our time) overlooking the water and some of the best snorkeling around right of the dock. We were on the ground floor and will go up next visit for more privacy, but the guests we met were pleasant and helpful, trading snorkeling and dining spots (Wil's, Blue Cactus, Cappriccio, Mona Lisa, and surpringly Paradise Moon were our favorites). Our good intentions of eating in (great full kitchen) worked mainly for breakfasts and lunches - the restaurants are one of the great attractions of Bonaire. That and the snorkeling, which is wonderful.
reviews.title: Best Luxury Value on Bonaire

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Bellafonte let us enjoy the relaxing comforts of your own place while offering most of the amenities of a good hotel ...and even more. Robert and his staff were great, around to help but not overwhelming. Robert even lent us his own beach chairs for our travels.
reviews.title: Views are great, location awesome, diving incredible!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's not a resort. But better
reviews.title: We would definitely return -wonderful view and space

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: My husband and I went to Bonaire for about our 13th trip and this time we wanted to stay somewhere different than where we had been staying. We mostly wanted something where we weren't having to walk all over the place when going from diving/rinse tanks/our room. We chose Bellafonte because it is right there at a great reef, the rinse tanks are withing a few feet of exiting the water, as well as a locked dive locker by the tanks. We stayed in Unit 401, which was the Penthouse, and it was unbelievable. The views were 180 degrees with a rap around porch. There is an elevator so it was so easy to bring our items to our room and parking is at the foot of the elevator. The grounds are kept up so well. Robbert, the manager, was awesome and he welcomed our dogs (2 Westies) and was attentive to our needs. This was truly one of the most relaxing vacations!
reviews.title: The manager, Robert, made this experience top notch!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have been to Bonaire over 8 times and have stayed in various accommodations. The Bellefonte was the most upscale we have had the chance to visit. The grounds are beautiful and definitely feel tropical. The views from the master bedroom and livingroom are excellent. Originally we were booked for the jr Studio but once we arrived we found the space too cramped however I am sure it would appeal to some folks who do not need a lot of room - Robert, the property manager, was very understanding and allowed us to upgrade at the last moment. Actually Robert made our stay even better - he was always available and accommodating. Nothing fazed him and he was always in a good mood. The only short fall, for some people, may be the lack of a swimming pool. For us it was not a problem - not when you have crystal clear caribbean waters to jump into! The kitchens are well stocked but I would bring plastic glasses for outdoor drinks as our unit did not have any.
reviews.title: Just returned from a wonderful week at Bellefonte

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Bellafonte the first few days of October 2011. Our flight got in late, luggage was later, so we decided to check out our room before heading back to the airport to grab our luggage. As promised, Robbert (fantastic manager) had done some grocery shopping for us - so we had beer and snacks waiting for us despite the late hour. Our air conditioning was broken, so the first night was a little toasty, but Robbert gave us a different room the first thing the next day, with an upgrade!! We were given great recommendations on places to eat - Bobbejan's and It Rains Fishes - and he helped with making reservations for kayaking. Snorkeling in front of the hotel was fantastic!! Would go back to Bonaire and the Bellafonte anytime...
reviews.title: Great rooms with spectacular views, and the hotel manager could not have been more helpful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from our 2nd stay at the Bellefonte (3rd trip to Bonaire). this time for two weeks at the end of September / early October, an almost too hot time of the year. But the excessive heat was the only problem. The Bellefonte was almost empty but our rooms were in good shape, Robbert attentive and very helpful, and the snorkeling out front incredible. Some of the resteraunts were closed or moving, but there are always enough excellant places to eat (Wil's, At Sea, and Mona Lisa to name our favorites). The Bonaire Regatta was held during our last week, which woke up downtown with nightly music and street vendors, a lot of fun.
reviews.title: 2nd Time As Good As The First

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don't know if we'd come back in September, but we'll definitely be returning and staying at the Bellefonte. For location and laid back comfort, it is the best.
reviews.title: Seventh Stay--Still the Best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: No, the Bellafonte is not a Ritz or Four Seasons. It is, however, a well-run, classy set of condos with a great location and extremely hospitable service, thanks to manager Robbert and his staff.
reviews.title: Nice place, but it's NOT a hotel!

aka: Bellafonte Chateau De La Mer Hotel
description: Bellafonte is a small and friendly resort on an intimate setting facing the sparkling blue Caribbean Sea and the everyday breathtaking sunset. It offers a fine selection of luxurious Studios, one- and two-bedroom 'apartment'-size Suites and spectacular Penthouses, each of them having a secluded veranda that unfolds the most beautiful panoramas.
